channel.title: TOS Agreement [Fixed]
channel.description:
[Originally posted in Questions]
I'm trying to make something similar to the TOS agreement and I'm not very familiar with PHP yet because I'm still learning/reading. Is there someone who could help me with making one? I want it so it creates a cookie or uses a variable to check if people have accepted the TOS before they go to each page.
EDIT: The page layout of it is different and so are the rules, thats just so you guys know. I saw previous posts where people complained they were leeching. People aren't leeching if you ask for help on a certain part of it. Just putting this out there to prevent problems. [b] EDIT2:[/b] I found a way of using the PHP variables to do this.

item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“I james I, post:4, topic:212448”][quote author=io9 link=topic=279796.msg2277280#msg2277280 date=1213510488]
or you could use MITB’s one just change da cookie names!!

http://moparisthebest.com/agreement.phps
!!!

[/quote]

Yes, but what do you put in a page that you want it to redirect too tos?[/quote]

That is a valid question. Basically you check if the cookie is there, and if not send them to the agreement page, if it is there then they have agreed and you can let them look at the page:

if(!isset($_COOKIE["cookie_name_goes_here"]))
  header("Location: http://".$_SERVER['SERVER_NAME'].($_SERVER['SERVER_PORT'] == 80 ? '' : ':'.$_SERVER['SERVER_PORT'])."/agreement.php?returnto=http://".$_SERVER['SERVER_NAME'].($_SERVER['SERVER_PORT'] == 80 ? '' : ':'.$_SERVER['SERVER_PORT']).$_SERVER['PHP_SELF']);
